qas.question: How many ancient canons exist in the Eastern Church?
How many ancient canons exist in the Western Church?
What is another term for Apostolic Canons?
When was the First Council of Nicaea held?
What is the Greek definition of κανὠν?
What does the Western church have eighty-five of?
What does the Eastern church have fifty of?
What is made up of a collection of ecclesiastical decrees and cannons?
What did the Ante-Nicene fathers call cannons?

context: The <b7_0>Apostolic Canons<b7_0/> or <a2_0>Ecclesiastical Canons<a2_0/> of the Same Holy Apostles is a collection of ancient <b5_0><b6_0>ecclesiastical decrees<b6_0/><b5_0/> (<a0_0>eighty-five<a0_0/> in the Eastern, <a1_0>fifty<a1_0/> in the Western Church) concerning the government and discipline of the Early Christian Church, incorporated with the Apostolic Constitutions which are part of the Ante-Nicene Fathers In the fourth century the <b9_0>First Council of Nicaea<b9_0/> (<a3_0>325<a3_0/>) calls canons the <b8_0>disciplinary measures of the Church<b8_0/>: the term canon, κανὠν, means in Greek, <a4_0>a rule<a4_0/>. There is a very early distinction between the rules enacted by the Church and the legislative measures taken by the State called leges, Latin for laws.
